question: Who became the first Indian to win the 1st World Para Swimming Championship Gold?
explanation: Nagpur's Kanchanmala Pande created history as she became the first Indian to secure pole position at the World Para-Swimming Championship in Mexico. The 26-year-old Reserve Bank of India employee won gold in the 200-metre medley event in the S-11 category and was also the only Indian to qualify for the women's category.
